metadata.Title: CVE-2019-11719 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium
metadata.Description:
When importing a curve25519 private key in PKCS#8format with leading 0x00bytes, it is possible to trigger an out-of-bounds read in the NetworkSecurity Services (NSS) library. This could lead to information disclosure.This vulnerability affects Firefox ESR < 60.8, Firefox < 68, andThunderbird < 60.8.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-11719` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libnss3 - 2:3.28.4-0ubuntu0.14.04.5+esm1
libnss3-1d - 2:3.28.4-0ubuntu0.14.04.5+esm1
libnss3-nssdb - 2:3.28.4-0ubuntu0.14.04.5+esm1
libnss3-tools - 2:3.28.4-0ubuntu0.14.04.5+esm1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: firefox: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
nss package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2:3.28.4-0ubuntu0.14.04.5+esm1').
